note.p: Birth: Bryn Helen, Caernarfonshire, Wales (15 February 1834)
Education: King's College, London; Royal Institution

Career: Apprenticed to the Electric and International Telegraph Company (1853); Engineer, Channel Islands Telegraph Company (1858-1862); Electrician (1870), Electrician in Chief (1877), then Engineer in Chief (1892-1899), General Post Office; a pioneer of wireless telegraphy
Memberships: AICE (1859); MICE (1872); Society of Telegraph Engineers; Physical Society; FRMS; FSA
References: Sir Bernard Lovell, 'The Invention of Radio Communication', review of Peter Rowlands and J Patrick Wilson, eds, Oliver Lodge and the Invention of Radio in NR 1997 vol 51 pp 151-153
Notes: List of papers no longer attached to election certificate.
